trans-unit.source: Step 3: Create and Configure LOB Targets
trans-unit.target: Step 3: Create and Configure LOB Targets

trans-unit.source: Connect to an on-premises LOB application by creating <token>lobrelay</token>s and <token>lobtarget</token>s in your <token>af_integration</token> application.
trans-unit.target: Connect to an on-premises LOB application by creating <token>lobrelay</token>s and <token>lobtarget</token>s in your <token>af_integration</token> application.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="2360e515-3493-4c35-92dc-87b587520697" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Bus Connect Architecture</link> describes how <token>lobrelay</token>s and <token>lobtarget</token>s manage connectivity with an on-premises LOB application.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="2360e515-3493-4c35-92dc-87b587520697" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Service Bus Connect Architecture</link> describes how <token>lobrelay</token>s and <token>lobtarget</token>s manage connectivity with an on-premises LOB application.

trans-unit.source: For the scenario used in this tutorial, Northwind stores the sales order data in a <embeddedLabel>SalesOrder</embeddedLabel> SQL Server table.
trans-unit.target: For the scenario used in this tutorial, Northwind stores the sales order data in a <embeddedLabel>SalesOrder</embeddedLabel> SQL Server table.

trans-unit.source: The steps in this section demonstrate how to create the <embeddedLabel>SalesOrder</embeddedLabel> SQL Server table, how to create an <token>lobrelay</token> and <token>lobtarget</token> to write data into the table, and then finally generate the message schema for inserting data into the table.
trans-unit.target: The steps in this section demonstrate how to create the <embeddedLabel>SalesOrder</embeddedLabel> SQL Server table, how to create an <token>lobrelay</token> and <token>lobtarget</token> to write data into the table, and then finally generate the message schema for inserting data into the table.

trans-unit.source: Specifically:
trans-unit.target: Specifically:

trans-unit.source: Create the SQL Server table
trans-unit.target: Create the SQL Server table

trans-unit.source: Use these steps to create the <embeddedLabel>SalesOrder</embeddedLabel> <token>ssNoVersion</token> table that contains the sales order data.
trans-unit.target: Use these steps to create the <embeddedLabel>SalesOrder</embeddedLabel> <token>ssNoVersion</token> table that contains the sales order data.

trans-unit.source: You can create the table in a database called <embeddedLabel>Orders</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: You can create the table in a database called <embeddedLabel>Orders</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Open <token>ssManStudioFull</token>.
trans-unit.target: Open <token>ssManStudioFull</token>.

trans-unit.source: Run the following query to create the <embeddedLabel>SalesOrder</embeddedLabel> table:
trans-unit.target: Run the following query to create the <embeddedLabel>SalesOrder</embeddedLabel> table:

trans-unit.source: Confirm the table is created in the target database.
trans-unit.target: Confirm the table is created in the target database.

trans-unit.source: Create the SQL Server LOBTarget
trans-unit.target: Create the SQL Server LOBTarget

trans-unit.source: Create the <token>lobrelay</token> and <token>lobtarget</token> for the <embeddedLabel>Insert</embeddedLabel> operation on the <embeddedLabel>SalesOrder</embeddedLabel> table:
trans-unit.target: Create the <token>lobrelay</token> and <token>lobtarget</token> for the <embeddedLabel>Insert</embeddedLabel> operation on the <embeddedLabel>SalesOrder</embeddedLabel> table:

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>EAIEDITutorial</embeddedLabel> project, select the <embeddedLabel>View</embeddedLabel> menu, and then select <legacyBold>Server Explorer</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>EAIEDITutorial</embeddedLabel> project, select the <embeddedLabel>View</embeddedLabel> menu, and then select <legacyBold>Server Explorer</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: To create an <token>lobrelay</token>, Visual Studio must be opened with administrator privileges.
trans-unit.target: To create an <token>lobrelay</token>, Visual Studio must be opened with administrator privileges.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Server Explorer</embeddedLabel>, right-click <embeddedLabel><token>lobconnect</token>s</embeddedLabel>, and then select <legacyBold>Add BizTalk Adapter Service</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Server Explorer</embeddedLabel>, right-click <embeddedLabel><token>lobconnect</token>s</embeddedLabel>, and then select <legacyBold>Add BizTalk Adapter Service</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: This prompts for the <token>lobconnect</token> Management URL.
trans-unit.target: This prompts for the <token>lobconnect</token> Management URL.

trans-unit.source: Enter the management URL.
trans-unit.target: Enter the management URL.

trans-unit.source: The <token>lobconnect</token> Management URL is the path to the ManagementService.svc WCF service hosted in IIS.
trans-unit.target: The <token>lobconnect</token> Management URL is the path to the ManagementService.svc WCF service hosted in IIS.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="355e839a-c2ca-48e2-bc2e-e3cd1ad32466" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Runtime: ServiceBus Connect Service Runtime Components</link> provides more information on the <token>lobconnect</token> components within IIS.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="355e839a-c2ca-48e2-bc2e-e3cd1ad32466" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Runtime: ServiceBus Connect Service Runtime Components</link> provides more information on the <token>lobconnect</token> components within IIS.

trans-unit.source: If the <token>lobconnect</token> Runtime is installed locally with the default settings, enter: <legacyBold>http://localhost:8080/BAService/ManagementService.svc/</legacyBold>
trans-unit.target: If the <token>lobconnect</token> Runtime is installed locally with the default settings, enter: <legacyBold>http://localhost:8080/BAService/ManagementService.svc/</legacyBold>

trans-unit.source: If the <token>lobconnect</token> Runtime is installed remotely with the default settings, enter: <legacyBold>http://ServerName:8080/BAService/ManagementService.svc/</legacyBold>
trans-unit.target: If the <token>lobconnect</token> Runtime is installed remotely with the default settings, enter: <legacyBold>http://ServerName:8080/BAService/ManagementService.svc/</legacyBold>

trans-unit.source: Select <legacyBold>OK</legacyBold>.
trans-unit.target: Select <legacyBold>OK</legacyBold>.

trans-unit.source: Expand the newly added server, expand <embeddedLabel>LOB Types</embeddedLabel>, right-click <embeddedLabel>SQL</embeddedLabel>, and select <embeddedLabel>Add SQL Target</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Expand the newly added server, expand <embeddedLabel>LOB Types</embeddedLabel>, right-click <embeddedLabel>SQL</embeddedLabel>, and select <embeddedLabel>Add SQL Target</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>Add a Target</embeddedLabel> wizard opens.
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>Add a Target</embeddedLabel> wizard opens.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Before You Begin</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Before You Begin</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Connection Parameters</embeddedLabel>, enter the <token>ssNoVersion</token> details and the credentials to use for the connection.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Connection Parameters</embeddedLabel>, enter the <token>ssNoVersion</token> details and the credentials to use for the connection.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: You can use the <embeddedLabel>Advanced</embeddedLabel> button to build the <token>ssNoVersion</token> connection URI and also enter the binding properties for the connection.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <embeddedLabel>Advanced</embeddedLabel> button to build the <token>ssNoVersion</token> connection URI and also enter the binding properties for the connection.

trans-unit.source: <externalLink><linkText>The SQL Server Connection URI</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=228970</linkUri></externalLink> provides additional information about how to build the URI.
trans-unit.target: <externalLink><linkText>The SQL Server Connection URI</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=228970</linkUri></externalLink> provides additional information about how to build the URI.

trans-unit.source: For binding properties, see <externalLink><linkText>Working with BizTalk Adapter for SQL Server Binding Properties</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=228971</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: For binding properties, see <externalLink><linkText>Working with BizTalk Adapter for SQL Server Binding Properties</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=228971</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, leave the default setting as-is for the binding properties.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, leave the default setting as-is for the binding properties.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Operations</embeddedLabel>, expand <embeddedLabel>Tables</embeddedLabel>, expand <embeddedLabel>SalesOrder</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Insert</embeddedLabel>, and then select the right arrow.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Operations</embeddedLabel>, expand <embeddedLabel>Tables</embeddedLabel>, expand <embeddedLabel>SalesOrder</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Insert</embeddedLabel>, and then select the right arrow.

trans-unit.source: The <embeddedLabel>Insert</embeddedLabel> operation is now listed under the <embeddedLabel>Selected categories</embeddedLabel> section.
trans-unit.target: The <embeddedLabel>Insert</embeddedLabel> operation is now listed under the <embeddedLabel>Selected categories</embeddedLabel> section.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Runtime Security</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Fixed Windows credential</embeddedLabel>, enter the credentials, and then select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Runtime Security</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Fixed Windows credential</embeddedLabel>, enter the credentials, and then select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: This security type determines how the client message is authenticated with the <token>lobtarget</token>.
trans-unit.target: This security type determines how the client message is authenticated with the <token>lobtarget</token>.

trans-unit.source: Options include:
trans-unit.target: Options include:

trans-unit.source: Fixed Username
trans-unit.target: Fixed Username

trans-unit.source: Use a username and password created locally on the LOB system.
trans-unit.target: Use a username and password created locally on the LOB system.

trans-unit.source: Fixed Windows credential
trans-unit.target: Fixed Windows credential

trans-unit.source: Use a Windows domain account.
trans-unit.target: Use a Windows domain account.

trans-unit.source: Custom SOAP Header
trans-unit.target: Custom SOAP Header

trans-unit.source: Use a custom-created SOAP header that includes the username and password.
trans-unit.target: Use a custom-created SOAP header that includes the username and password.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Deployment</embeddedLabel>, create a new <token>lobrelay</token> or choose an existing one.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Deployment</embeddedLabel>, create a new <token>lobrelay</token> or choose an existing one.

trans-unit.source: A single <token>lobrelay</token> can be used with multiple <token>lobtarget</token>s.
trans-unit.target: A single <token>lobrelay</token> can be used with multiple <token>lobtarget</token>s.

trans-unit.source: There are restrictions based on the security model.
trans-unit.target: There are restrictions based on the security model.

trans-unit.source: As a best practice, group the same security method in one <token>lobrelay</token>.
trans-unit.target: As a best practice, group the same security method in one <token>lobrelay</token>.

trans-unit.source: For example, use the same <token>lobrelay</token> to host the <token>lobtarget</token>s that use Message Credential or Fixed Windows security type.
trans-unit.target: For example, use the same <token>lobrelay</token> to host the <token>lobtarget</token>s that use Message Credential or Fixed Windows security type.

trans-unit.source: To create a new <token>lobrelay</token>:
trans-unit.target: To create a new <token>lobrelay</token>:

trans-unit.source: Namespace
trans-unit.target: Namespace

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Enter your <token>sb2</token> namespace; the LOB relay is created in the <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: Enter your <token>sb2</token> namespace; the LOB relay is created in the <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: The namespace name is available in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=211879</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: The namespace name is available in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?LinkId=211879</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Issuer Name
trans-unit.target: Issuer Name

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The <token>sb2</token> Issuer Name, listed in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=211879</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: The <token>sb2</token> Issuer Name, listed in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=211879</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Issuer Secret
trans-unit.target: Issuer Secret

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The <token>sb2</token> Issuer Secret key, listed in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=211879</linkUri></externalLink>.
trans-unit.target: The <token>sb2</token> Issuer Secret key, listed in the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=211879</linkUri></externalLink>.

trans-unit.source: Relay Path
trans-unit.target: Relay Path

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Enter the desired name of the relay path.
trans-unit.target: Enter the desired name of the relay path.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, set this property to <userInput>OrderProcessing</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, set this property to <userInput>OrderProcessing</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Target Sub-path
trans-unit.target: Target Sub-path

trans-unit.source: <embeddedLabel>Required</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: <embeddedLabel>Required</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Enter a sub-path to make this target unique.
trans-unit.target: Enter a sub-path to make this target unique.

trans-unit.source: For example, you can enter <userInput>SQLGetOrder</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For example, you can enter <userInput>SQLGetOrder</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Target runtime URL
trans-unit.target: Target runtime URL

trans-unit.source: This is automatically populated with the namespace name, relay path, and target sub-path you entered.
trans-unit.target: This is automatically populated with the namespace name, relay path, and target sub-path you entered.

trans-unit.source: If using the examples above, it is populated with something like:
trans-unit.target: If using the examples above, it is populated with something like:

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Next</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Summary</embeddedLabel>, review your values.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Summary</embeddedLabel>, review your values.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>Create</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>Create</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: When the wizard completes, select <embeddedLabel>Finish</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: When the wizard completes, select <embeddedLabel>Finish</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The following events occur in the background:
trans-unit.target: The following events occur in the background:

trans-unit.source: The <token>lobtarget</token> is created in Server Explorer.
trans-unit.target: The <token>lobtarget</token> is created in Server Explorer.

trans-unit.source: It can be disabled, started, and deleted.
trans-unit.target: It can be disabled, started, and deleted.

trans-unit.source: Its configuration can also be exported.
trans-unit.target: Its configuration can also be exported.

trans-unit.source: The <token>lobtarget</token> is created as an application in IIS.
trans-unit.target: The <token>lobtarget</token> is created as an application in IIS.

trans-unit.source: This application uses the Runtime for this specific <token>lobtarget</token>.
trans-unit.target: This application uses the Runtime for this specific <token>lobtarget</token>.

trans-unit.source: <link xlink:href="355e839a-c2ca-48e2-bc2e-e3cd1ad32466" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Runtime: ServiceBus Connect Service Runtime Components</link> describes the IIS components.
trans-unit.target: <link xlink:href="355e839a-c2ca-48e2-bc2e-e3cd1ad32466" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Runtime: ServiceBus Connect Service Runtime Components</link> describes the IIS components.

trans-unit.source: To use the LOB Target
trans-unit.target: To use the LOB Target

trans-unit.source: Right-click anywhere on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, and update the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL</embeddedLabel> property to include your <token>af_integration</token> name.
trans-unit.target: Right-click anywhere on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design area, select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>, and update the <embeddedLabel>BizTalk Service URL</embeddedLabel> property to include your <token>af_integration</token> name.

trans-unit.source: This is the name you entered in <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=211879</linkUri></externalLink> when creating the <token>af_integration</token>.
trans-unit.target: This is the name you entered in <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=211879</linkUri></externalLink> when creating the <token>af_integration</token>.

trans-unit.source: Set the security property for the relay endpoint:
trans-unit.target: Set the security property for the relay endpoint:

trans-unit.source: Right-click the <token>lobtarget</token> in Server Explorer and select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the <token>lobtarget</token> in Server Explorer and select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the Properties grid, select the ellipsis <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> next to the <embeddedLabel>Runtime Security</embeddedLabel> property.
trans-unit.target: In the Properties grid, select the ellipsis <embeddedLabel>(…)</embeddedLabel> next to the <embeddedLabel>Runtime Security</embeddedLabel> property.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Edit Security</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Fixed Windows Credentials</embeddedLabel>, and enter username and password to connect to the <token>ssNoVersion</token>.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Edit Security</embeddedLabel>, select <embeddedLabel>Fixed Windows Credentials</embeddedLabel>, and enter username and password to connect to the <token>ssNoVersion</token>.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Drag and drop the <token>lobtarget</token> onto the design area.
trans-unit.target: Drag and drop the <token>lobtarget</token> onto the design area.

trans-unit.source: Note the <legacyBold>Entity Name</legacyBold> property of the <token>lobtarget</token>.
trans-unit.target: Note the <legacyBold>Entity Name</legacyBold> property of the <token>lobtarget</token>.

trans-unit.source: The default value is <legacyItalic>Relay-Path_target-sub-path</legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: The default value is <legacyItalic>Relay-Path_target-sub-path</legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: If using the examples above, it is <legacyItalic>orderprocessing_sqlgetorder</legacyItalic>.
trans-unit.target: If using the examples above, it is <legacyItalic>orderprocessing_sqlgetorder</legacyItalic>.

trans-unit.source: Open the .config file for the <token>lobtarget</token>, which typically has the <legacyItalic>YourRelayPath_target-sub-path.config</legacyItalic> naming convention.
trans-unit.target: Open the .config file for the <token>lobtarget</token>, which typically has the <legacyItalic>YourRelayPath_target-sub-path.config</legacyItalic> naming convention.

trans-unit.source: Enter the <token>sb2</token> issuer name and issuer secret, as shown:
trans-unit.target: Enter the <token>sb2</token> issuer name and issuer secret, as shown:

trans-unit.source: Save changes to the config file.
trans-unit.target: Save changes to the config file.

trans-unit.source: Generate the schema
trans-unit.target: Generate the schema

trans-unit.source: Generate the schema for the <embeddedLabel>Insert</embeddedLabel> operation on the <embeddedLabel>SalesOrder</embeddedLabel> table.
trans-unit.target: Generate the schema for the <embeddedLabel>Insert</embeddedLabel> operation on the <embeddedLabel>SalesOrder</embeddedLabel> table.

trans-unit.source: You can use the <token>lobtarget</token> you created in the previous step.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <token>lobtarget</token> you created in the previous step.

trans-unit.source: Right click the <embeddedLabel>test01/orderprocessing/sqlgetorder</embeddedLabel> entity in Server Explorer, and then select <embeddedLabel>Add schemas To EAIEDITutorial</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Right click the <embeddedLabel>test01/orderprocessing/sqlgetorder</embeddedLabel> entity in Server Explorer, and then select <embeddedLabel>Add schemas To EAIEDITutorial</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: This menu property is enabled only if <token>af_integration</token> project is open in <token>vsprvs</token>.
trans-unit.target: This menu property is enabled only if <token>af_integration</token> project is open in <token>vsprvs</token>.

trans-unit.source: In <embeddedLabel>Schema Generation</embeddedLabel>, set the file name prefix to <userInput>EAIEDITutorial_SalesOrder_</userInput>, and leave the folder name to its default value of <userInput>LOB Schemas</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: In <embeddedLabel>Schema Generation</embeddedLabel>, set the file name prefix to <userInput>EAIEDITutorial_SalesOrder_</userInput>, and leave the folder name to its default value of <userInput>LOB Schemas</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Select credential Type as <embeddedLabel>Windows</embeddedLabel> and then select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Select credential Type as <embeddedLabel>Windows</embeddedLabel> and then select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: An <embeddedLabel>LOB Schemas</embeddedLabel> folder is created within the project and the generated schemas are added under it.
trans-unit.target: An <embeddedLabel>LOB Schemas</embeddedLabel> folder is created within the project and the generated schemas are added under it.

trans-unit.source: The schema for the Insert operation on the <embeddedLabel>SalesOrder</embeddedLabel> table is created with the <legacyItalic>EAIEDITutorial_SalesOrder_TableOperation.dbo.SalesOrder.xsd</legacyItalic> name.
trans-unit.target: The schema for the Insert operation on the <embeddedLabel>SalesOrder</embeddedLabel> table is created with the <legacyItalic>EAIEDITutorial_SalesOrder_TableOperation.dbo.SalesOrder.xsd</legacyItalic> name.
